title:
A point-variety incidence theorem over finite fields, and its
  applications
abstract:
Incidence problems between geometric objects is a key area of focus in the
field of discrete geometry. Among them, the study of incidence problems over
finite fields have received a considerable amount of attention in recent years.
  In this paper, by characterizing the singular values and singular vectors of
the corresponding incidence matrix through group algebras, we prove a bound on
the number of incidences between points and varieties of a certain form over
finite fields. Our result leads to a new incidence bound for points and flats
in finite geometries, which improves previous results for certain parameter
regimes. As another application of our point-variety incidence bound, we prove
a result on pinned distance problems by Phuong et al. and Cilleruelo et al.
under a weaker condition.
